comment: Professor Rhea is a good choice for this class because he has a clear grading criteria and is friendly. Hes always willing to help us and see us succeed. His end of semester project is tedious as he has a specific page limit, but he gives you plenty of time to complete it. Just dont wait last minute and you will be good.

If you're thinking about taking him, do it before all the spots are gone! Professor Rhea is a great teacher and one of the best in Coles and the IS Program. He makes his lectures fun and interesting and you will learn a lot of very applicable lessons if you seek to do more than get a grade. Great choice for any class.

Professor Rhea is a very good professor. He is very clear about everything in the class and answers questions well. He also spent a lot of time telling students about specific companies and internship opportunities. His class is not very hard as long as you follow the rules and study. Definitely take him if you can.

Professor Rhea was a great professor to have. His lectures were very informative and he gave great feedback on the case studies and group project. He always encourages class discussion for the most interesting topics. He was also amazing at letting know about and giving us opportunities in the Information Systems industry. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Such an easy class. Professor Rhea is one of my favorite teachers. Everything is in class; tests & quizzes. Quizzes you have to do from memory but Test open note, open book. Super easy if you review the chapters. Group project super easy. Honestly take him! he cares about his students and if you communicate with him he will work with you!

I am taking him this semester and he is one of my favorite professors ever! I am not an IS major but because of him I am probably going to minor in it. Exams are open note/powerpoint but the weekly quizzes are not. Quizzes are only 10 questions each so it's not awful. Group project and case studies aren't bad as long as you put in the effort. 10/10

Other than weekly quizzes, this professor was awesome. He was so nice and always had a smile on his face. Tests are open book/notes, but quizzes are not! He is available to anyone outside of class and tries to help out however he can. TAKE HIM!!!!!!

Really nice guy. Teaches straight from the textbook and even uses textbook powerpoints. Grades more on following instructions than actual content. Weekly chapter quizzes, three tests, 2 case studies, and a group paper and presentation that is pretty easy. Didn't learn a ton but wasn't hard to pass.
I took Busa 3150 with him and on his Clifton Strengths assessment you couldnt find not even half the answers in the book.

My favorite professor at KSU! Prof Rhea is a real gem. Not only does he make concepts understandable, but he also has open book/notes tests. He gives students the opportunity to be engaged in class and actually learn. I did use the textbook for tests and it was very helpful, but it is not really necessary since he puts notes on D2L. He really cares

TAKE THIS MAN. The best IS professor at kennesaw, no doubt. Get to know him as well, he has very good connections and genuinely cares about his students. Go to class he is so engaging and interesting. Quizzes are easy, and tests are all open notes and open book.

This is my second course with Rhea, he's an awesome professor, handful of small quizzes, open-book open note tests, and some case studies with a group project at the end of the semester. Rhea incorporates a lot of real-world experience with lectures.
If you've been lucky enough to get a seat in one of professor Rhea's classes, congratulations. Be respectful, communicate, and listen and you should get a good grade.

Awesome professor! Super clear about exactly how he likes everything. The four case analysis are pretty detailed and kind of a pain but easy A if you follow the instructions to a T. Test are open note but quizzes are closed note 10 minutes and 10 questions. Group project is a large part of your grade but he gives plenty of time in class to work on.

I took Prof Rhea in a maymester and it was my favorite class I have taken since charging my major to business. He's very understanding. Grades you based on if your work meets the requirements, not necessarily the thought. He knows you have an opinion and respects that. 5 quizzes 3 test 3 case study(EASY!!!) and a group proj 20 pgs. Project is easy!

If you get the opportunity to take a class with Professor Rhea TAKE IT!! He is an easy professor but you learn a lot in his class. He also cares about his students and their futures. Class is made up of 5 quizzes, 3 tests (open book) and a couple assignments. Just pay attention and you'll be fine!
He is the best. The exams and quizzes are not that bad. The papers are easy but take a lot of time. overall the class should be an easy A for anyone if you take the time to do the work.
The most stylish professor in the game. Keep doing you you Rhea Rhea

Rhea is the one of the few professors in the IS department who still cares about his students. Really wants people to succeed and goes out of his way to offer helpful advice and new opportunities. The class material is pretty boring, but he does his best to make it fun. Easy A if you do all the work. There is a group project, but nobody is perfect.

Professor Rhea is awesome! He really shows he cares about his students and is passionate about the IS field. All you have to do is listen in class! the quizzes are from the powerpoints and the tests are open note! The group project and case studies are easy if you just follow instructions.

Carefully read the criteria on the papers and the case analysis.  Make sure it meets the guidelines.  Tests are open notes/book done online in class.  Quiz after every two chapters, not hard at all.  Project is big! But prepare and again, FOLLOW THE GUIDELINES and you'll be fine.  Takes attendance.

Do NOT call him an easy A!!! The tests are open book, but that doesn't make them easy. There is no extra credit. There are also 3 4-page papers with very strict guidelines. Also, there is a group project with a 20 page paper and a presentation. He is a very nice guy with a friendly, laid-back personality; but his grading policy contradicts that.

you have to have a full 4 page Case Study paper in order to receive a 100. I really dont think he even reads them he just pay attention to the length. But he also states that quality is more important then quantity..? And he was also very shady and rude to students at time. he isn't very approachable he belittles if you had misunderstood something.

Take this for an IS elective!!! He is awesome professor! The class is broken down into 3 exams (open book), 5 10 question quizzes, two SAP games, two cases studies, and a group project. The quizzes are easy( multiple choice or t/f questions) Case studies are easy, just follow is guidelines of format and spell check. Would take again and again!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: The best IS professor! Makes the subject super interesting and bearable compared to IS 2100. Just listen in class to pass, or read the book (which is not difficult or boring to get through). Professor is super super nice and approachable, and really cares for all of us! Definitely take him if you can.

I took this professor for a Maymester and it was fantastic. He let us come in a little late and leave early most days. There is a group project though. It's not difficult, but you will need to really keep yourself to a schedule (as with any Maymester). I am a Marketing major and he's convinced me to get an IS minor. That's how much I liked this guy

Professor Rhea is one of the best professors at KSU.  He is there to teach, not to beat up students like many other professors.  His class is easy, but you could fail if you don't know the material.  If you know the material, it is not hard and you will have a good time.

Professor Rhea is awesome!!! One of my favorite professors at KSU. 3 open book tests which are online in class.  1 group project which is not hard. As long as you the assignments you will get a good grade. He cares about his students and wants them to get good jobs. Not out to get you on grading at all. Nice, funny, easy, caring all around greatguy

Take Him!!! One of the best professors in the IS department. There are 3 tests (open book and PowerPoint), 7 quizzes over chapters (no book or notes. but there are over stuff from notes), 3 case studies (just meet the page requirement and sources), and paper and presentation. Don't worry, he's not a harsh grader on presentation.

3 tests, 6 quizzes, and one group project presentation. Tests and quizzes open notes. Put in some effort and get an A. He actually teaches real world applications. He doesn't just go through a bunch of terminology like other professors. Great Professor! Take him!

One of the best professors I've had. He's super friendly and approachable. He is the kind of person who wants you to do well and is there for you when you need him. There are assignments but he is not a harsh grader, just be sure to meet deadlines. All tests are in class and open book. I highly recommend taking him if you wish to do well in IS 3100

He was a great professor. Easy grader but make sure to submit the assignments on time. Open book notes & PowerPoint on tests. Only downside was a team project & presentation. Super easy A. I definitely recommend him!

He is a great professor who makes the course work fun by encouraging a collaborative environment. He is very understanding when students need to make up work for missed classes. He's an easy grader, but don't slack. He doesn't accept late work, but deadlines are in the syllabus. Easy A if you just do the work.

Great Professor, very organized! Relates the subject matter to real life scenarios. Simple 10 question quizzes, open book tests, a group project and a few written assignmentscase studies...a good bit of busy work, but all-in-all pretty easy. I never studied, just showed up for class and had the book present for tests and made an A.

I took this course as a hybrid. There is 1 group projectpresentation, 6 quizzes (in class) and 5 essay style quizzes (online), 4 tests (online, but in class),  and 3 papers. Professor Rhea is a tough grader. The tests are pretty tricky! Honestly, I didn't study at all and got a high B out of the class. Just do your work and you'll do fine.
Professor Rhea is a very lenient grader. Just follow the guidelines and do the assignments, he will give you full credit. His tests are not very hard. They are open book, and notes. Take him.
Rhea was really great and made a very boring subject fun. He put in to real everyday terms the more technical jargon. Some friends are considering majors because of him!

Fairly easy class. Definitely have to do some reading if you want to pass with an A or B. I found it to be very boring and tedious. The material isnt challenging and tests are open book, quizzes arent. Very so so

Gets pretty particular with his rules and guidelines, but it is an easy class. Exams are open-note, open-book. Took him on a Saturday and there was a quiz almost every class day. He takes attendance every day, so show up. Easy A

Great professor. Uses real world examples to explain things. Classes are sometimes boring, but easy. Open book, notes tests. Which are not to bad. A few papers, which he grades on exactly how he says he will. Group project that isn't too bad. Overall easy course if you put in the effort.

Wes Rhea is a great teacher.  this class is super easy, the tests are open book and the few quizes are only 10 easy questions.  there is a group project but it is easy, if you do it you practically get a 100.  there are also 3 case studies that you have to do but they only take 30 mins to do
Maymester: 3 open book tests, 5 quizes(not open book), group project(yes in 2 weeks). Not hard to get A.
3 open book tests & a final. Quizzes-not open book. 1 group project. EASY A. Very nice and understanding guy. Very informative and intelligent personality, quite experienced.

He really seems to enjoy teaching, and it shows.  He was a former CIO, and has done a good bit of consulting, so he brings a lot of experience to the classroom. There are 3 open book tests, 5 quizzes, 3 (easy) 'essay' type assignments, and a group project.  One word of caution:  choose your group team members carefully.  Good class, easy "A."

One of the best professors I have had at KSU. Extremely helpful, class is interesting, tests are open book. He expects you to come to class and follow directions on assignments. Not asking a lot really. Super nice guy, and really entertaining. Knows his subject matter as well. That says a lot.

Take this class with Rhea.  The class is easy, however there is a lot of work that has to be completed before the middle of the semester.  Choose your group project team members carefully.  Take this class with one your hardest classes.  Finally, get to know this professor.  He is probably one of the nicest, most humble, respectful, and inciteful.

I'm glad I took Rhea. He is a good teacher, but he's also just a cool guy to know... He gives 10 Question quizzes on each chapter. I did not receive anything lower than a 91 on any assignment in his class. Takes roll but it is not for a grade. Tests are online you must take them in class even though they're open book open notes. I highly reccomend

Dr. Rhea is the bomb. Very helpful and understanding. Takes role, so be in class. He makes it pretty interesting. 3 tests. 50-60 multiple choice questions on each. Quizzes after every 2 chapters. An easy group project. Easy class. Very Easy B. I got a 95 in the class with minimal studying. Definitely would take him 100 times over.

Very cool professor. He knows his stuff and is very fair. I took him for a maymester and found it to not be really bad. He's very nice and down to earth. Gives hints as to what will be covered on the tests or quizzes. He also has a large amount of experience in the field.

I took him for the may session. Unbelievably easy!!! Daily quizzes immediately following lecture on simple material. No group project. Just a case assignment and career research assignment graded leniently. Also, very congenial prof. who knows how to convey tech. info. well. Take him!
Take him!!! He makes the class easy and fun! 3 open book test and 7 easy quizzes! Very helpful professor

Best teacher that I have had at KSU to date! I actually enjoyed getting up at 7am on my Saturday to attend his class. Mix of online (inclass) quizzes, 3 open book tests, two assignments, one group project (totally painless).
Easy A but he cares about his students. He guides students towards career paths and marketable jobs.
Great professor, makes the course EASY! Don't need the book, everything is on PowerPoints. A few quizzes, 3 open book/note exams, 2 easy papers, and a group project.

Awesome professor - really cares about his students.  Jokes with the class, very easy going.  You have to work hard to not pass.  All tests are open notes/books.  Just took the final tonight, left the class with a 96%.  Highly recommended to anyone who needs a class he teaches!!! A++

Awesome professor. I'd take him any day. Uses real world situations as examples. Tests are all online and very easy if you study. 1 group presentation for both 2100/3100. Definitely in my top 10 professors of all time! Take him for 2100 and 3100 if you have the chance!

He is one of the best professors I had taken. He is funny, really cares about his students grade, willing to help, and lectures are fun too. 4 exams (easy if you read the majority of the chapters & open books/notes), quizzes are easy too, and one project w/ presentation. Attendance can boost your grade.

Good professor. The class is kinda fun, his quizzes/tests are heavily derived from the slides more so than the book, though it is still important to read. Really easy A if you study a little and be sure to show up (attendance carries a good weight of your grade). Nice guy, really cares about real-life application and students' success. Recommended.

I liked the mostly direct style of teaching.  I appreciated that team project was in the middle of the semester instead of the end, and it was challenging but not ridiculous.  The subjects discussed in the class were usually uninteresting, even if the professor was entertaining. Quizzes and tests were decent, a pretty easy A or B.
One of the best professors at KSU! There is a lot of work but if you keep up with the syllabus then you will make an A!

The subject is boring but the professor makes it so fun. I loved going to class but sometimes, the weather stands in the way (an hour in traffic is no fun on a rainy day). I would've got an A in the class but I slacked off a little. I recommended Rhea!
Prof. Rhea is the man.  His test are open book and he is actually cool to listen to during lectures.  Go to class and pay attention and you will get an A.  Highly recommend
This guy is great. Definitely not a boring prof. He is very funny and outgoing. Class is easy, do the work(not time consuming at all) and go to class.

The material is so dry but Prof. Rhea is funny. The class was super easy. 6 quizzes, 4 tests, a group project, a writing assignment, and no final. Attendance is 10% of your grade though so you do need to come to class. All in all, an easy A.
Great Teacher, very interesting class. Worth getting up at 7am for.
Great teacher, open book tests, pick your groups wisely for the group project.
Awesome prof! He's really easy and very nice! Highly recommended!!

Pretty easy class. One group project done at beginning of semester. Tests are open book. Attendance is graded. Lectures are boring but professor attempts to get you involved so it's not too bad. Overall a good class, would take him again.

Prof. Rhea is a great guy:nice, knowledgeable and funny. The material is pretty dry, but he does his best to make things interesting and relevant. The major project is done at the beginning of the semester, which is great as it really eases your work load at crunch time. Quizes and tests are easy, you cant go wrong here. Just know attendance counts
Great professor!  He allows class time to work on projects, etc.  I would definitely take him again.
He is the absolute BEST. he makes the subject interesting and you really do learn a lot. Love the guest speakers. TAKE him!! and he's hot
He is one of the best professors I've ever had!!!

Awesome teacher! Lets you use book on test. Group project is easy and he gives plenty of time in class. Assignments are easy and he basically looks to see if you did them and gives you a 100. Highly recommend him.

Very easy professor!!  Highly recommend him for 2100, I am going to take him for 3100 in the fall.  I made an A and probably went to class about 5 times the entire semester...all his quizzes and tests are online and you DO NOT need the book!

i love this guy, i failed this class last semester but when i took prof rhea, i came out with an A. The class material is dry but you would never know just because he is THAT good. Take him and you'll want him for every course!!
Super nice dude who gives tons of extra credit that no one really even needed.  Easy, def. take him for both bism's
Enjoyed his class and the speakers he brings in. Good professor who has alot of pratical business experience. Highly recommend.

Understands that BISM 2100 is boring. There is one group project you have to do but he gives you tons of time in class to work with your groups so you don't have to meet outside of class if you take advantage of that time. Nice guy, easy class, would recommend.

The first day of class he says, "I know this stuff is pretty boring so I won't take it personal if you fall asleep." <-He's such a cool, easy teacher. We didn't even do the school mandatory Excel project. The class was so easy!
